bioghist.p: Frank Gill (1941- ) joined the Academy of Natural Sciences shortly after receiving his Ph.D. in zoology from the University of Michigan in 1969. He held several positions, including Curator of Ornithology (1969-1995), Chairman of the Department of Ornithology, Chairman of the Department of Vertebrate Biology, and Director of the Division of Systematic and Evolutionary Biology. He was also an Adjunct Associate Professor at the University of Pennsylvania. Gill did fieldwork in several parts of the world, including Costa Rica and Africa, and led Academy member trips. His research interests were avian systematics, DNA sequencing, Allozymes, restriction site analysis of mitochondrial DNA, and DNA-DNA hybridization.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains data and manuscripts for research projects, including: the Hermit Hummingbird flight patterns (1980s); East African Sunbird project (1970s); Physiology and Biology of High Montane Nectar-feeding Birds; and Birds, Bees and Passion Flowers. Documents in the collection include: annotated typescript drafts; reprints; negatives and photo prints of birds, data graphs, and other figures; data and research notes; reviewer comments; equipment lists and expense reports from expeditions; and expedition notebooks. There is correspondence in the collection between Gill and his colleagues, discussing his research projects; and there are letters between Gill and editors discussing the review and publication of the studies. The collection also includes unidentified audio tapes.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
